intro: Macropeplus ligustrinus var. dentatus, commonly known as the toothed spurge. This variant of the spurge plant is characterized by its distinctive toothed leaves, which give it its scientific name. It is a flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its milky sap that can be toxic. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its small yellowish-green flowers appear in clusters and are followed by capsule fruits that disperse its seeds.
